title: "How does developing context help in shifting from being the content to being the context of our lives?"
first_phrase: In the previous section, the author explained the concept of "context" and how our identification with the content of our lives limits our experiences and resources. In the last 200 tokens, the author highlights the importance of understanding that we are not our problems or symptoms, rather, we are the realer and knower of them. The author emphasizes that therapy should focus on awakening this larger context in anyone seeking a resolution of a problem or symptom. Additionally, the author mentions their upcoming resource, "Quantum Consciousness: The Discovery and Birth of Quantum Psychology-The Physics of Consciousness," which explores different ways of disidentifying from our experiences.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the key point to take away from this book is that you are not your problem; you are the solution to your problem. By disidentifying with the problem and understanding the larger context of your being, you can access your inner resources and create new states of being. Embracing the concept of context can empower you to take control of your mind and achieve resolution without compartmentalizing it.
